lead_paragraph: Flyers goalie Antero Niittymaki will receive cortisone shots in his injured left hip and try to avoid surgery. Niittymaki tore the labrum in his left hip during practice Tuesday morning. An operation would sideline him up to three months. Instead, Niittymaki, who tied a team rookie record with 23 victories last season, will try injections this week, in December and before the playoffs in combination with rehabilitation.
